parameter.name: Description
parameter.defaultValue: SpanTreeLayout is a strategy for drawing directed graphs that works by first extracting a spanning tree (more accurately, a spanning forest), and using this both to position graph vertices and to plan the placement of non-tree edges.

parameter.name: Reference
parameter.defaultValue: SpanTreeLayout is based on an approach to 3D graph layout first developed as part of the tulip tool by Dr. David Auber at LaBRI, U.Bordeaux.

parameter.name: Depth First Spanning Tree
parameter.defaultValue: If set, base the layout on a depth-first spanning tree, rather than the default breadth-first spanning tree. Switching between DFT and BFT may significantly change the layout, and choice must be made on a per-graph basis.
